meanings.definition: The body of ideas or information that is widely believed within a particular fandom, but has no official confirmation from the original source material.
meanings.sent1: In the fan community, the fanon about the characters' backstories is often more elaborate than what is shown in the actual series.
meanings.sent2: Many fans enjoy discussing fanon theories about their favorite shows with fellow enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The fanon idea that the main character is secretly a superhero in disguise adds an interesting twist to the story.
meanings.sent4: Her fanon about the magical powers of the protagonist turned out to be surprisingly accurate in the later seasons.
meanings.sent5: The fanon surrounding the mysterious origins of the antagonist makes the plot even more intriguing.

meanings.definition: A piece of fan-created content, such as fan fiction or fan art, that is based on existing characters or settings from a work of fiction.
meanings.sent1: She proudly displayed her fanon artwork of the characters at the convention.
meanings.sent2: The fanon story she wrote about the characters became incredibly popular online.
meanings.sent3: Creating fanon illustrations of the characters allowed her to explore her artistic skills.
meanings.sent4: The fanon comic book series she created brought a fresh perspective to the characters' adventures.
meanings.sent5: His fanon fan fiction delved into the untold love story between the two main characters.
